subject: Real Estate
title: Location, Location, Location
description: Learn Location, Location, Location in one minute.

hook.text: Two identical houses can differ in price by $500,000 â€” purely because of where they sit.

buildup.text: Proximity to jobs, schools, transit, and amenities drives value more than the building itself.

discovery.text: The building depreciates over time. The land underneath almost always appreciates.

twist.text: In many expensive cities, the land is worth 80% of a home's total value. The house is just 20%.

climax.text: When people say 'location, location, location,' they really mean 'land, land, land.'

punchline.text: You're not buying a house. You're buying dirt.

quiz.question: In expensive cities, what usually makes up most of a home's value?
